SEARCH
Package ObjectUI

Class DoctorUI

java.lang.Object
ObjectUI.DoctorUI
All Implemented Interfaces:
BaseUI
public class DoctorUI extends Object implements BaseUI
DoctorUI class represents the user interface for doctor-related functionalities. It allows the doctor to interact with the system to view and update patient records, set availability, manage appointments, and more.

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from interface ObjectUI.BaseUI

    database, pharmacy

  • Constructor Details

    • DoctorUI

      public DoctorUI(Doctor doctor)
      Constructs a DoctorUI instance for a specific doctor. Displays a menu of actions that the doctor can perform, such as viewing or updating records, setting availability, and managing appointments. The interface runs in a loop until the doctor chooses to log out.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the Doctors object representing the doctor using this interface

  • Method Details

    • viewPatient

      public void viewPatient(Doctor doctor)
      Displays the list of ongoing patients under the doctor's care and allows the doctor to view a selected patient's medical record. If no patients are under the doctor's care, a message is displayed. Otherwise, the doctor can enter a patient ID to view the corresponding medical record and appointment history.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • updatePatientMR

      public void updatePatientMR(Doctor doctor)
      Updates the medical record of a patient by allowing the doctor to edit the latest consultation notes. This method displays ongoing appointments and prompts the doctor to select a patient to update their record. If the selected patient has previous completed appointments, the doctor is prompted to edit the latest notes. Function Flow: 1. Displays ongoing appointments for the doctor. 2. Prompts the doctor to enter a patient ID. 3. If the patient has past appointments, asks if the doctor wants to edit the latest notes. 4. Updates the notes if confirmed by the doctor.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • viewSchedule

      public void viewSchedule(Doctor doctor)
      Displays the doctor's availability schedule for the upcoming week. Clears the console, then prints the first week's time slots using the doctor's `printFirstWeekTimeSlot` method. Waits for user input before returning to the main menu.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • setAvailability

      public void setAvailability(Doctor doctor)
      Allows the doctor to modify their availability for a specific date and time. The method first displays the current week's schedule, then prompts the doctor to select a date and time slot to update. It also verifies the chosen slot's availability status and ensures there are no conflicts with existing appointments before updating the availability.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • aptReq

      public void aptReq(Doctor doctor)
      Allows the doctor to manage pending appointment requests by viewing the list of pending appointments, selecting an appointment ID, and choosing to accept or decline the appointment. If no pending appointments are available, a message is displayed to indicate this.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • viewOngoingAPT

      public void viewOngoingAPT(Doctor doctor)
      Displays the list of ongoing appointments for the doctor. If there are ongoing appointments, each appointment's patient ID, patient name, and appointment ID are displayed. If there are no ongoing appointments, a message is shown to indicate this.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor

    • recordAptOutcome

      public void recordAptOutcome(Doctor doctor)
      Records the outcome of an ongoing appointment by allowing the doctor to add prescriptions, enter consultation notes, and mark the appointment as completed. The method prompts the doctor to add medicines to the patient's prescription if desired, then finalizes the appointment with consultation notes. If there are no ongoing appointments, it displays a message and exits.
      Parameters:
      doctor - the current doctor
